name: Mohg's Great Rune
caption:
A Great Rune of the shardbearer Mohg.

Mohg and Morgott are twin brothers, and their Great Runes are naturally similar.

But Mohg's rune is soaked in accursed blood, from his devout love for the wretched mire that he was born into far below the earth.
info:
Bless every summoned spirit in your world with the Blessing of Blood so their kills heal you for 10% of your <font color="#E0B985">maximum HP</font>.
Blessed allies gain 20% increased <font color="#E0B985">attack power</font> for 20 seconds whenever blood loss occurs nearby.
Receive three Phantom Great Runes when invading that can bless nearby native enemies; the first use costs HP and later uses only expend the rune.
Activate this Great Rune at a site of grace and use a Rune Arc to sustain the blessing until death; it cannot bless players.

name: Malenia's Great Rune
caption:
A Great Rune of the shardbearer Malenia.

Malenia is daughter to Queen Marika and Radagon, and her Great Rune should have been the most sacred of all.
info:
Restore HP with attacks for 5 seconds after taking damage, up to the amount of the most recent hit, with each blow resetting the maximum you can regain.
Reduce healing from the Flask of Crimson Tears by 15% while the rune is active.
Equip the rune and consume a Rune Arc at a site of grace to keep its blessing until death.

name: Baldachin's Blessing
caption:
Favor bestowed by a deathbed companion. Protection of a hidden temple in the guise of a bedchamber.

The favor allows one to forget any aches and pains. In Death, there is only peace, for in Death, there can be no sensation.
info:
While carried, reduce your <font color="#E0B985">maximum HP</font> by 5%, then restore the missing HP once the blessing expires or leaves your inventory.
On use, reduce <font color="#F395C4">physical damage</font> received by 35% and <font color="#E0B985">poise damage received</font> by 34% for 15 seconds, preventing stagger from most light and medium hits without increasing maximum <font color="#E0B985">poise</font>.
Counts as a body buff and will not stack with other effects of that type.

name: Radiant Baldachin's Blessing
caption:
Protection of a hidden temple in the guise of a bedchamber. This blessing is of the utmost rarity.

It is said a deathbed companion will only produce a blessing of this kind for a champion but once in her entire life. The sole blessing which she imbues of her own volition.
info:
On use, reduce <font color="#F395C4">physical damage</font> received by 35% and <font color="#E0B985">poise damage received</font> by 45% for 70 seconds, preventing stagger from most light and medium hits without increasing maximum <font color="#E0B985">poise</font>.
Counts as a body buff, so it will not stack with other body-type buffs.
Unlike the lesser blessing, it imposes no penalty to your <font color="#E0B985">maximum HP</font> while carried.

name: Terra Magica
caption:
One of the glintstone sorceries of the Academy of Raya Lucaria.

Once, the sigil would be cast from the highest belfry of the academy, covering the entire institution's grounds. This spell allows such vivid experience of spell-casting success, it turns many a fledgling into a true sorcerer in a flash of newfound understanding.
info:
Draw an academy sigil that amplifies the magic of anyone standing within.
Empower yourself and allies who deal damage while inside the sphere.

<font color="#57DBCE">Base magic damage</font> increase (sigil): 22% for 30 seconds
Category: Glintstone

name: Glintblade Phalanx
caption:
One of the sorceries of the Carian royal family.

Bestowed upon the enchanted Carian knights, who combined this art with their swordsmanship to maintain pressure upon their foes, striking in waves of steel and sorcery.
info:
Summon an arc of tracking glintblades overhead that automatically fire at nearby targets.
Create five spectral blades that hover overhead and shatter if they strike walls or ceilings.

<font color="#57DBCE">Base magic damage</font> (each blade): 60
Category: Carian, Glintblade

name: Thops's Barrier
caption:
The lifelong pursuit of Thops the Bluntstone.

Future generations will learn. They will know the foolishness of the sneering sorcerers who ridiculed this theory, little realizing that it was in fact a discovery worthy of a new conspectus of the academy.
info:
Conjure a glintstone barrier that swats away hostile spells.
Produce a brief parry window that deflects sorceries and incantations, and hold to repeat the barrier.

Category: Glintstone

name: Black Flame's Protection
caption:
A black flame incantation of the Godskin Apostles.

The Apostles were all embraced by the Gloam-Eyed Queen, and the black flame was their armor within.
info:
Draw black flame within to harden the body while blunting restorative power.
Increase <font color="#F395C4">physical damage negation</font> by 35% but reduce all healing by 20% for 70 seconds; this counts as a body buff that cannot stack with similar effects.

Category: Godskin, Godslayer

name: Bestial Sling
caption:
Incantation taught by Gurranq, the Beast Clergyman.

It is said that in the time before the Erdtree, stones were the first weapons of the beasts who had gained intelligence.
info:
Unleash a rapid spray of stone shards in a forward cone.
Fire immediately after other actions, making it ideal for flinching low-<font color="#E0B985">poise</font> foes.

<font color="#F395C4">Base physical damage</font> (per shard): 87
Category: Bestial

name: Mohg's Great Rune
caption: The Great Rune of the shardbearer Mohg, devoid of any benediction.
info:
This inert Great Rune must have its benediction restored at its Divine Tower before it grants Mohg's blessing.
After restoration, it can be equipped and activated with a Rune Arc like any other Great Rune.

name: Malenia's Great Rune
caption: The Great Rune of the shardbearer Malenia, devoid of any benediction.
info:
This inert Great Rune must have its benediction restored at its Divine Tower before it grants Malenia's blessing.
After restoration, it can be equipped and activated with a Rune Arc like any other Great Rune.

name: Cerulean Hidden Tear
caption: A crystal tear formed slowly over the ages where the Erdtree's bounty falls to the ground.
info:
Mix into the Flask of Wondrous Physick to remove all <font color="#E0B985">FP</font> costs for 10 seconds when the draught is consumed.
Perform actions that normally exceed your available <font color="#E0B985">FP</font>, but the effect ends immediately after the duration expires.

name: Hefty Fire Pot
caption:
Craftable item prepared using a capacious cracked pot.

A goodly amount of materials is sealed inside.
info:
Throw a capacious cracked pot that erupts in flame on impact, dealing heavy area damage and knocking most foes to the ground.
Deal massive damage to Furnace Golems when hurled into the vents atop their armor.

<font color="#F48C25">Base fire damage</font>: 360

name: Hefty Rock Pot
caption:
Craftable item prepared using a capacious cracked pot.

Filled to the brim with crushed rocks—nothing clever about it.
info:
Throw a weighty pot that explodes into crushing force, dealing high strike damage in a small area and toppling most targets.
Damage scales strongly with <font color="#E0B985">Strength</font>, giving heavy builds a ranged option without consuming <font color="#E0B985">FP</font>.

<font color="#F395C4">Base physical damage</font>: 370
<font color="#C0B194">Stance damage</font>: 15

name: Hefty Lightning Pot
caption:
Craftable item prepared using a capacious cracked pot.

A goodly amount of materials is sealed inside.
info:
Throw a capacious pot that bursts into a violent lightning strike, dealing severe area damage and knocking most targets down.
Damage scales primarily with <font color="#E0B985">Dexterity</font>, letting agile builds deliver potent ranged bursts without expending <font color="#E0B985">FP</font>.

<font color="#FFE033">Base lightning damage</font>: 370
<font color="#C0B194">Stance damage</font>: 10

name: Hefty Fetid Pot
caption:
Craftable item prepared using a capacious cracked pot.
A heaping mass of effluents is sealed inside. As the mixture ferments, toxins are produced alongside a putrid stench that seeps out once ripe.

Push someone in a privy; expect to get dung on your hands.
info:
Throw to splatter enemies with <font color="#40BF40">Deadly Poison</font> buildup while dealing strike impact.
Also inflict 200 <font color="#40BF40">Deadly Poison</font> buildup on yourself.

<font color="#F395C4">Base physical damage</font>: 105
<font color="#C0B194">Stance damage</font>: 5
Status buildup: 500-727 <font color="#40BF40">Deadly Poison</font> to targets (scales with <font color="#E0B985">Arcane</font>)
Self-inflicted buildup: 200 <font color="#40BF40">Deadly Poison</font>
<font color="#40BF40">Deadly Poison</font>: Deals 0.14% of <font color="#E0B985">maximum HP</font> plus 12 per second for 30 seconds (4.2% of <font color="#E0B985">maximum HP</font> plus 360 total).

name: Hefty Fly Pot
caption:
Craftable item prepared using a capacious cracked pot.
A heaping mass of effluents is sealed inside.

The maggots found in waste feed on blood and turn into vicious flies that are pitiably short-lived.
info:
Throw to strike and release a bloodfly swarm that pursues foes for up to 7 hits.
The first swarm hit applies negligible <font color="#C84343">Hemorrhage</font> buildup before the remaining flies inflict heavy buildup.

<font color="#F395C4">Base physical damage</font> (impact): 105
<font color="#C0B194">Stance damage</font> (impact): 5
<font color="#F395C4">Base physical damage</font> (swarm hit): 116
Status buildup: minimal <font color="#C84343">Hemorrhage</font> on first hit; 70-101 <font color="#C84343">Hemorrhage</font> per hit on the next 6 hits (420-606 total), scales with <font color="#E0B985">Arcane</font>

name: Hefty Freezing Pot
caption:
Craftable item prepared using a capacious cracked pot.
A goodly amount of materials is sealed inside.
info:
Throw to knock foes down and inflict <font color="#9DD7FB">Frostbite</font> in a wide area.

<font color="#57DBCE">Base magic damage</font>: 200
<font color="#C0B194">Stance damage</font>: 10
Status buildup: 400 <font color="#9DD7FB">Frostbite</font>
<font color="#9DD7FB">Frostbite</font>: Inflicts damage equal to 10% of <font color="#E0B985">maximum HP</font> plus 30, then increases all damage received by 20% for 30 seconds.

name: Hefty Poison Pot
caption:
Craftable item prepared using a capacious cracked pot.
A goodly amount of materials is sealed inside.
info:
Throw to deal strike impact while inflicting <font color="#40BF40">Poison</font> buildup on targets.

<font color="#F395C4">Base physical damage</font>: 105
<font color="#C0B194">Stance damage</font>: 5
Status buildup: 400-582 <font color="#40BF40">Poison</font> (scales with <font color="#E0B985">Arcane</font>)
<font color="#40BF40">Poison</font>: Deals 0.07% of <font color="#E0B985">maximum HP</font> plus 7 per second for 90 seconds (6.3% of <font color="#E0B985">maximum HP</font> plus 630 total).

name: Hefty Oil Pot
caption:
Craftable item prepared using a capacious cracked pot.
A goodly amount of materials is sealed inside.
info:
Soak targets in oil for 30 seconds, causing the next single instance of <font color="#F48C25">fire damage</font> they take to deal 65% more damage.
Does not stack with Oil Pot.

name: Hefty Volcano Pot
caption:
Craftable item prepared using a capacious cracked pot.
A goodly amount of materials is sealed inside.
info:
Throw to create a searing cloud that damages enemies inside for up to 10 hits over 5 seconds.

<font color="#F48C25">Base fire damage</font> (per hit): 105
<font color="#C0B194">Stance damage</font> (per hit): 5
Hits: Up to 10

name: Hefty Frenzied Flame Pot
caption:
Craftable item prepared using a capacious cracked pot.
A goodly amount of materials is sealed inside.

The flame of frenzy burns the eyes, but tranquility follows in its wake. May this pot bring salvation to those it strikes.
info:
Throw to deal <font color="#F48C25">fire damage</font> and <font color="#C0B194">stance damage</font> while causing <font color="#EEAA2B">Madness</font> buildup that scales with <font color="#E0B985">Strength</font>, <font color="#E0B985">Dexterity</font>, <font color="#E0B985">Intelligence</font>, and <font color="#E0B985">Faith</font>.

<font color="#F48C25">Base fire damage</font>: 326
<font color="#C0B194">Stance damage</font>: 10
Status buildup: 130 <font color="#EEAA2B">Madness</font>
<font color="#EEAA2B">Madness</font>: Inflicts damage equal to 15% of <font color="#E0B985">maximum HP</font> plus 100 and reduces <font color="#E0B985">FP</font> equal to 10% of <font color="#E0B985">maximum FP</font> plus 30 when it triggers against Tarnished.

name: Hefty Rancor Pot
caption:
Craftable item prepared using a capacious cracked pot.
Enchanted by the ancient death hex.

In times of old, the dead were burned with ghostflame, and from those cinders arose vengeful spirits.
info:
Consume <font color="#E0B985">FP</font> to summon eight homing spirit skulls after the throw.
Game data currently lists them as dealing <font color="#FFE033">lightning damage</font>.

Base damage: 310 lightning (current game data)
<font color="#C0B194">Stance damage</font>: 10

name: Hefty Magic Pot
caption:
Craftable item prepared using a capacious cracked pot.
A goodly amount of materials is sealed inside.
info:
Consume <font color="#E0B985">FP</font> to hurl a blast that knocks targets down.

<font color="#57DBCE">Base magic damage</font>: 360
<font color="#C0B194">Stance damage</font>: 10
Scaling: <font color="#E0B985">Intelligence</font>

name: Hefty Rot Pot
caption:
Craftable item prepared using a capacious cracked pot.
A goodly amount of materials is sealed inside.

Rot is one of the divine elements of the outer gods, and eats away at life like a vicious plague.
info:
Throw to deal strike impact while applying <font color="#EF7676">Scarlet Rot</font> buildup.

<font color="#F395C4">Base physical damage</font>: 105
<font color="#C0B194">Stance damage</font>: 5
Status buildup: 400 <font color="#EF7676">Scarlet Rot</font>
<font color="#EF7676">Scarlet Rot</font>: Deals 0.33% of <font color="#E0B985">maximum HP</font> plus 13 per second for 90 seconds (29.7% of <font color="#E0B985">maximum HP</font> plus 1,170 total).

name: Hefty Furnace Pot
caption:
Craftable item prepared using a capacious cracked pot.
Imbued with a hex of the furnace.

The furnace's flame burns away both body and soul.
When impurity is thus expunged, one calls it cleansing.
info:
Throw to generate a whirlwind that launches foes into the air.
Can be hurled into a Furnace Golem's brazier to deal massive damage and awaken inert golems.

<font color="#F48C25">Base fire damage</font>: 370
<font color="#C0B194">Stance damage</font>: 10

name: Hefty Red Lightning Pot
caption:
Craftable item prepared using a capacious cracked pot.
A goodly amount of materials is sealed inside.

The ancient dragons who betrayed their lord to side with a tyrant were known for wielding branching red lightning.
info:
Throw to deal red <font color="#FFE033">lightning damage</font> and create an electric field that links lightning to nearby enemies.

<font color="#FFE033">Base lightning damage</font>: 310
<font color="#C0B194">Stance damage</font>: 10

name: Red Lightning Pot
caption:
Craftable item prepared using a ritual pot.
A cocktail of materials is sealed inside.

The ancient dragons who betrayed their lord to side with a tyrant were known for wielding branching red lightning.
info:
Throw to deal red <font color="#FFE033">lightning damage</font> and create an electric field that chains lightning to surrounding enemies.

<font color="#FFE033">Base lightning damage</font>: 260
<font color="#C0B194">Stance damage</font>: 3

name: Frenzied Flame Pot
caption:
Craftable item prepared using a cracked pot.
A cocktail of materials is sealed inside.

The flame of frenzy burns the eyes, but tranquility follows in its wake. May this pot bring salvation to those it strikes.
info:
Throw to deal <font color="#F48C25">fire damage</font> while causing <font color="#EEAA2B">Madness</font> buildup that scales with <font color="#E0B985">Strength</font>, <font color="#E0B985">Dexterity</font>, <font color="#E0B985">Intelligence</font>, and <font color="#E0B985">Faith</font>.

<font color="#F48C25">Base fire damage</font>: 240
<font color="#C0B194">Stance damage</font>: 3
Status buildup: 90 <font color="#EEAA2B">Madness</font>
<font color="#EEAA2B">Madness</font>: Inflicts damage equal to 15% of <font color="#E0B985">maximum HP</font> plus 100 and reduces <font color="#E0B985">FP</font> equal to 10% of <font color="#E0B985">maximum FP</font> plus 30 when it triggers against Tarnished.

name: Eternal Sleep Pot
caption:
Craftable item prepared using a ritual pot.
Enchanted by the incantations of St. Trina.

The weak are powerless to resist this velvety sleep, and will never be roused again.
info:
Consume <font color="#E0B985">FP</font> to create a sleep mist that applies 15 ticks of <font color="#A698F4">Sleep</font> buildup over 3 seconds, scaling with <font color="#E0B985">Arcane</font>.

Status buildup per tick: 29 <font color="#A698F4">Sleep</font> baseline (435 total); 30 at 10 <font color="#E0B985">Arcane</font> (450 total); 38 at 30 <font color="#E0B985">Arcane</font> (570 total); 40 at 60 <font color="#E0B985">Arcane</font> (600 total); 42 at 99 <font color="#E0B985">Arcane</font> (630 total)

name: Roped Frenzied Flame Pot
caption:
Craftable item prepared using a cracked pot.
A cocktail of materials is sealed inside, and a short rope that aids throwing has been secured around the pot.

The flame of frenzy burns the eyes, but tranquility follows in its wake. May this pot bring salvation to those it strikes.
info:
Hurl the pot behind you, detonating in frenzied flame that deals <font color="#F48C25">fire damage</font> in a small area, inflicts <font color="#EEAA2B">Madness</font> buildup, and deals <font color="#C0B194">stance damage</font>.

<font color="#F48C25">Base fire damage</font>: 240
<font color="#C0B194">Stance damage</font>: 3
Status buildup: 90 <font color="#EEAA2B">Madness</font>
<font color="#EEAA2B">Madness</font>: Inflicts damage equal to 15% of <font color="#E0B985">maximum HP</font> plus 100 and reduces <font color="#E0B985">FP</font> equal to 10% of <font color="#E0B985">maximum FP</font> plus 30 when it triggers against Tarnished.

name: Blessing of Marika
caption:
A special physick blessed by Marika, the queen of the Erdtree.

Marika once created several of these physicks for Messmer's sake.
But never again.
info: Fully restores HP and cures all status ailments.

name: Lulling Branch
caption:
Tree branch blessed with a velvety purple incantation.
Craftable item.

In the midst of drowsiness, there is the will to awaken.
Feelings that rise from the depths of one's heart.
info:
Restore 5 <font color="#E0B985">FP</font> every 2 seconds for 60 seconds (150 total) while gradually inducing <font color="#A698F4">Sleep</font>.
Build 20 <font color="#A698F4">Sleep</font> buildup every 2 seconds across the duration (up to 315 total); if the induced drowsiness causes temporary fogginess, no <font color="#E0B985">FP</font> is lost when the effect ends.

name: Dragon Communion Flesh
caption:
A lump of animal flesh with a heat that never cools.
Craftable item.

An imitation of dragonscale flesh created by human hands, used to sate the hunger of drake warriors—if only briefly.
info:
Raise <font color="#E0B985">vigor</font>, <font color="#E0B985">endurance</font>, <font color="#E0B985">strength</font>, and <font color="#E0B985">dexterity</font> by 6 for 90 seconds.
Drain 4 HP per second for 90 seconds.

name: Dragonscale Flesh
caption:
A lump of hot flesh carved from beneath the inverted scales said to grow on aged dragons.

To the drake warriors, there is no more intoxicating liquor than the heat of dragons.
info:
Raise <font color="#E0B985">vigor</font>, <font color="#E0B985">endurance</font>, <font color="#E0B985">strength</font>, and <font color="#E0B985">dexterity</font> by 8 for 90 seconds.
Drain 4 HP per second for 90 seconds.

name: Fingerprint Nostrum
caption:
Bolus engraved with whorl-like lines.
Craftable item.

A secret medicine of those who attempt to turn their human bodies into fingers. Ingesting causes something to wriggle within.
info:
Raises <font color="#E0B985">mind</font>, <font color="#E0B985">intelligence</font>, <font color="#E0B985">faith</font>, and <font color="#E0B985">arcane</font> by 6 for 90 seconds while draining 3 HP per second.

Does not stack with other Body Buffs.

name: Spellproof Pickled Liver
caption:
Animal liver pickled in a blue medicinal solution.
Craftable item.

The effects of the forager brood's pickled delights are enhanced by the fermentation, or rotting, of the ingredients. Though this results in a pungent odor, some come to find the aroma irresistible.
info:
Boosts <font color="#57DBCE">magic damage negation</font> by 25% for 120 seconds.

Does not stack with other Body Buffs.

name: Fireproof Pickled Liver
caption:
Animal liver pickled in a red medicinal solution.
Craftable item.

The effects of the forager brood's pickled delights are enhanced by the fermentation, or rotting, of the ingredients. Though this results in a pungent odor, some come to find the aroma irresistible.
info:
Boosts <font color="#F48C25">fire damage negation</font> by 25% for 120 seconds.

Does not stack with other Body Buffs.

name: Lightningproof Pickled Liver
caption:
Animal liver pickled in a yellow medicinal solution.
Craftable item.

The effects of the forager brood's pickled delights are enhanced by the fermentation, or rotting, of the ingredients. Though this results in a pungent odor, some come to find the aroma irresistible.
info:
Boosts <font color="#FFE033">lightning damage negation</font> by 25% for 120 seconds.

Does not stack with other Body Buffs.

name: Holyproof Pickled Liver
caption:
Animal liver pickled in a gold medicinal solution.
Craftable item.

The effects of the forager brood's pickled delights are enhanced by the fermentation, or rotting, of the ingredients. Though this results in a pungent odor, some come to find the aroma irresistible.
info:
Boosts <font color="#F5EB89">holy damage negation</font> by 25% for 120 seconds.

Does not stack with other Body Buffs.

name: Opaline Pickled Liver
caption:
Animal liver pickled in an opaline medicinal solution.
Craftable item.

The effects of the forager brood's pickled delights are enhanced by the fermentation, or rotting, of the ingredients. Though this results in a pungent odor, some come to find the aroma irresistible.
info:
Boosts magic, fire, lightning, and <font color="#F5EB89">holy damage negation</font> by 18% for 120 seconds.

Does not stack with other Body Buffs.

name: Well-Pickled Turtle Neck
caption:
Turtle neck meat that has been thoroughly pickled in a bitter solution.

The effects of the forager brood's pickled delights are enhanced by the fermentation, or rotting, of the ingredients. Though this results in a pungent odor, some come to find the aroma irresistible.
info: Raises <font color="#E0B985">stamina regeneration</font> by 12 for 60 seconds.

name: Scorpion Stew
caption:
Scorpion simmered in a black soup.
Traditional meal of the hornsent.

Once made with love by a certain elderly woman for the family table.
Having long gone cold, this soup gives off a rank, sour smell.
info:
Boosts <font color="#F395C4">physical damage negation</font> by 10% and restores 8 HP per second for 60 seconds (480 total).

Counts as both a Body Buff and a health regen buff and does not stack with others of those types.

name: Gourmet Scorpion Stew
caption:
Scorpion simmered in a black soup.
An exquisite dish chock-full of mouth-watering scorpion claws.

The thoughts and feelings of the cook melt and blend into the stew, but those who can distinguish the taste of love are few and far between.
"Partake, partake, until thou art sated."
info:
Boosts <font color="#F395C4">physical damage negation</font> by 10% and restores 12 HP per second for 60 seconds (720 total).

Counts as both a Body Buff and a health regen buff and does not stack with others of those types.

name: Scorpion Stew
caption:
Scorpion simmered in a black soup.
Traditional meal of the hornsent.

Having long gone cold, this soup gives off a rank, sour smell.
info:
Boosts <font color="#F395C4">physical damage negation</font> by 10% and restores 8 HP per second for 60 seconds (480 total).

Counts as both a Body Buff and a health regen buff and does not stack with others of those types.

name: Gourmet Scorpion Stew
caption:
Scorpion simmered in a black soup.
An exquisite dish chock-full of mouth-watering scorpion claws.

The thoughts and feelings of the cook melt and blend into the stew, but those who can distinguish the taste of love are few and far between.
info:
Boosts <font color="#F395C4">physical damage negation</font> by 10% (8% in PvP) and restores 12 HP per second for 60 seconds (720 total).

Counts as both a Body Buff and a health regen buff and does not stack with others of those types.

name: Sacred Bloody Flesh
caption:
Raw meat soaked with blood.
A delicacy of the bloodfiends.

The blood is said to have fallen from the Formless Mother's wound. Never will it dry, never will it rot.
info:
Increases physical <font color="#E0B985">attack power</font> by 7% and <font color="#E0B985">Arcane</font> by 10 for 30 seconds. While this buff is active, nearby blood loss grants an additional 18% <font color="#F395C4">physical damage</font> for 30 seconds, and further blood loss while the initial buff remains resets that timer.

Does not stack with other Body Buffs.

name: Silver Horn Tender
caption:
Old currency used by hornsent made by coating spiral horns with silver.

These trinkets were once symbolic of society's upper echelons.
info:
Increases Discovery by 60 for 3 minutes.

Cannot stack with Silver-Pickled Fowl Foot; stacks with Silver Scarab for up to +135 Discovery.

name: Golden Horn Tender
caption:
Old currency used by hornsent made by coating spiral horns with gold.

Once bestowed upon inquisitors as an honor.
info:
Increases rune acquisition by 40% for 3 minutes.

Cannot stack with Gold-Pickled Fowl Foot; stacks with Golden Scarab for up to a 68% rune acquisition increase.

name: Messmerfire Grease
caption:
Solidified knotgrease made from a mixture of incendiary materials.

Fire was a symbol of the crusade, and even Messmer's rank-and-file soldiers would wield it.
info: Coats the right-hand armament to add 120 flat <font color="#F48C25">Fire damage</font> for 60 seconds.

name: Dragonbolt Grease
caption:
Solidified knotgrease made from a mixture of fulminating materials.

Said to have been a favored tool of the dragon-cult knights who once served the prince of gold.
info: Coats the right-hand armament to add 120 flat <font color="#FFE033">Lightning damage</font> for 60 seconds.

name: Royal Magic Grease
caption:
Solidified knotgrease made from a mixture of magically resonant materials.

Believed to have once been bestowed upon low-ranking Carian knights in lieu of the fellowship's characteristic swords.
info: Coats the right-hand armament to add 120 flat <font color="#57DBCE">Magic damage</font> for 60 seconds.

name: Golden Grease
caption:
Solidified knotgrease made from a mixture of holy resonant materials.

Enchanted with an ancient Erdtree incantation.
Such ministrations are all but a lost art in the realm of shadow.
info: Coats the right-hand armament to add 120 flat <font color="#F5EB89">Holy damage</font> for 60 seconds.

name: Eternal Sleep Grease
caption:
Solidified knotgrease made from a mixture of deep-purple materials.

The weak are powerless to resist this velvety sleep, and will never be roused again.
info: Coats the right-hand armament to inflict <font color="#A698F4">Eternal Sleep</font> for 60 seconds.

name: Dragon Communion Grease
caption:
Solidified knotgrease made from a sharp gravel-stone mixture.

A tool of the old Dragon Communion warriors, who were the agents of the ancient dragons' hatred for their lowborn descendants.
info: Coats the right-hand armament to increase damage against Ancient Dragons by 28% and against Normal Dragons by 38% for a short time.

name: Drawstring Messmerfire Grease
caption:
Solidified knotgrease made from a mixture of incendiary materials.
A short string is attached to this lump.

Fire was a symbol of the crusade, and even Messmer's rank-and-file soldiers would wield it.
info: Coats the right-hand armament to add 135 flat <font color="#F48C25">Fire damage</font> for 25 seconds.

name: Drawstring Dragonbolt Grease
caption:
Solidified knotgrease made from a mixture of fulminating materials.
A short string is attached to this lump.

Said to have been a favored tool of the dragon-cult knights who once served the prince of gold.
info: Coats the right-hand armament to add 135 flat <font color="#FFE033">Lightning damage</font> for 25 seconds.

name: Drawstring Royal Magic Grease
caption:
Solidified knotgrease made from a mixture of magically resonant materials.
A short string is attached to this lump.

Believed to have once been bestowed upon low-ranking Carian knights in lieu of the fellowship's characteristic swords.
info: Coats the right-hand armament to add 135 flat <font color="#57DBCE">Magic damage</font> for 25 seconds.

name: Drawstring Golden Grease
caption:
Solidified knotgrease made from a mixture of holy resonant materials.
A short string is attached to this lump.

Enchanted with an ancient Erdtree incantation.
Such ministrations are all but a lost art in the realm of shadow.
info: Coats the right-hand armament to add 135 flat <font color="#F5EB89">Holy damage</font> for 25 seconds.

name: Drawstring Eternal Sleep Grease
caption:
Solidified knotgrease made from a mixture of deep-purple materials.
A short string is attached to this lump.

The weak are powerless to resist this velvety sleep, and will never be roused again.
info: Coats the right-hand armament to inflict 37 <font color="#A698F4">Eternal Sleep</font> buildup for 25 seconds.

name: Festive Grease
caption:
Solidified knotgrease made from a mixture of bone shards.

The delightful festival is an old tradition; one old enough for the Erdtree to tacitly tolerate its endurance.
info: Coats armament in a festive incantation that adds 100 <font color="#F5EB89">Holy damage</font> and grants 25 runes per hit for 60 seconds.

name: Innard Meat
caption:
Scraps of flesh for filling great jars.
Rancorous spirits cling to the pinkish-red, twitching meat.

This is what becomes of the condemned, who get sliced up and stuffed into jars to become saints instead.
info: Throw to deal damage that scales with <font color="#E0B985">strength</font>, <font color="#E0B985">dexterity</font>, <font color="#E0B985">intelligence</font>, and <font color="#E0B985">arcane</font> at D rank.

name: Dragon Communion Harpoon
caption:
Harpoon bristling with sharp gravel stones.

A tool of the old Dragon Communion warriors, who were the agents of the ancient dragons' hatred for their lowborn descendants.
info:
Throw to inflict piercing damage with an anti-dragon effect, dealing +30% damage to Normal Dragons and +15% to Ancient Dragons, and charge by holding Use Tool to extend range and damage.

Benefits from the Axe Talisman and Smithing Talisman.

name: Rock Heart
caption:
Heart consumed in the ancient, original form of Dragon Communion.

The last thing the partaker saw with human eyes was a sunset, its colors faded and tarnished—a remote thing from eternity.
info: Transform into an Ancient Dragon, boosting Dragon Communion incantations by 20% for 60 seconds while granting +10% to all damage negations and +50 to each of the four status resistances.

name: Priestess Heart
caption:
The stone heart of a Dragon Communion priestess.

The priestess was once an ancient dragon herself, but sacrificed that form for feeble flesh to aid in the destruction of Bayle the Dread.
info: Transform into an Ancient Dragon while disrobed; a second use activates a 20% boost to Dragon Cult incantations for 60 seconds. This form grants +7% damage negation, +70 to all resistances, and forbids wearing armor.

name: Lamenter's Mask
caption:
A stone mask twisted into an expression of rapturous grief.

This transformation tallies with the state of a denizen of paradise, but the people of the tower denied and hid it from the world. In their foolishness, they viewed true bliss with deep fear.
info: Transform into a lamenter while disrobed, dealing strike damage to nearby foes until death ends the form; using the item again causes the head to swell. This form increases <font color="#E0B985">arcane</font> by 8 and raises damage negation by 5% for all types (20% for holy).

name: Ancient Dragon's Blessing
caption:
Favor bestowed by the Dragon Communion priestess in the name of the dragon lord Placidusax.

Each night, the priestess offers her own sleep to her lord, and in turn receives the power of His favor.
info:
Consume <font color="#E0B985">FP</font> to increase all damage negation by 10% and guarding damage negation by 20% for 70 seconds.

This aura buff does not stack with other aura buffs.

name: Iris of Grace
caption:
An iris blessed with an incantation of the Erdtree.

In the realm of shadow, this artifice was employed by the priests of the Erdtree to quell the fears of their flock to magnificent effect.
info: Place on another's eye to grant them the light of grace as a fleeting blessing or use it yourself to receive the blessing of an equipped Great Rune as a consumable substitute for a Rune Arc.

name: Iris of Occultation
caption:
An iris that is as dark as night.

In the realm of shadow, this artifice was employed by the priests of the Erdtree to intensify the fears of their flock to magnificent effect.
info: Place on another's eye to deny them light in all its forms or use it yourself to receive the blessing of an equipped Great Rune at the cost of all runes currently held; consumed upon use.

name: Spritestone
caption:
A Rauh Burrow inhabited by a sprite.
According to the records left by hornsent scholars, there were also contrivances known as "bondstones" that could manipulate the moment that the sprite vanishes.
info:
Use <font color="#E0B985">FP</font> to release a sprite that slowly homes in on a locked target before detonating in a spiritual explosion of glittering light.
Without a lock-on, it travels straight ahead until it detonates when near an enemy, reaches maximum range, collides with a surface, or is shattered early with a bondstone.
Scales with <font color="#E0B985">arcane</font> most and with <font color="#E0B985">intelligence</font> and <font color="#E0B985">faith</font> at lower rates.

name: Horned Bairn
caption:
Doll of a tanglehorn bairn.
Tangled horns are a symbol of spirituality, but most young born bearing the oversized horns meet a frightfully early demise. These fetishes are made to memorialize them.
info:
Use <font color="#E0B985">FP</font> to summon six vengeful spirits that orbit the caster before autonomously chasing foes and detonating for <font color="#F5EB89">holy damage</font>.
Scales with <font color="#E0B985">intelligence</font> and <font color="#E0B985">faith</font>.

name: Perfumed Oil of Ranah
caption:
A small bottle wrapped in a bright-red cloth.
Filled with flammable perfume oil.
The dancers of Ranah keep these concealed as they dance, marking the height of their passion with an explosion of searing flame and sweet, enticing scents.
info: Spout flames forward, bathing the area ahead in searing perfume and lingering <font color="#F48C25">fire damage</font>; benefits from <font color="#F48C25">fire damage</font> boosts but gains nothing from the Perfumer's Talisman.

name: Surging Frenzied Flame
caption:
Spiritgrave stone burned by frenzied flame.
Spirits are eternal, and yet frenzied flame melts them away regardless. No wonder the hornsent forbid the flame's use.
info: Place a spiritgrave stone that spews a continuous torrent of frenzied flame until it expires, rapidly inflicting <font color="#EEAA2B">Madness</font> buildup alongside <font color="#F48C25">fire damage</font> on anything caught within its reach.

name: Golden Vow
caption:
Remains that turned into light after being blessed with an incantation of the Erdtree.
The incantation serves as a rite that honors the comrades who placed their faith in the distant Erdtree and gave their lives in the crusade.
info:
Raise <font color="#E0B985">attack power</font> and damage negation for the caster and nearby allies for 45 seconds; counts as an aura buff and will not stack with others of the same type.

<font color="#E0B985">Attack power</font>: +11.5% for 45 seconds (+2.5% in PvP)
Damage negation: +7.5% for 45 seconds (+1.5% in PvP)

name: Fire Coil
caption:
A device of fire used by Messmer's soldiers.
Lingering embers, bundled into a coil.
Fire was a symbol of the crusade, and even Messmer's rank-and-file soldiers would wield it.
info:
Conjure tiny fire snakes from the point of impact, sending them slithering after foes to bite for <font color="#F48C25">fire damage</font>.

Attack rating: 125 base; 230 at 20 <font color="#E0B985">Faith</font>, 335 at 50, 374 at 80

name: Fire Spritestone
caption:
A Rauh Burrow inhabited by a fire sprite.
Of all the sprites, the fire sprites are said to be the most boisterous in nature.
info: Release a fire sprite that bounces along the ground, piercing through enemies and scorching them as it keeps rolling until it dissipates naturally regardless of how many targets it hits; unaffected by bondstones.

name: Glinting Nail
caption:
Nailstone with shining fingerprints floating above.
The lampreys that guard the finger ruins resemble fingers far more than they do humans, and so the finger-weavers imitated their sorcery.
info: Fling a glinting magic nail that crumbles during flight, scattering shards that strike for <font color="#57DBCE">magic damage</font> even if intercepted, letting its fragments curve around shields and obstacles.

name: Sunwarmth Stone
caption:
Spiritgrave stone blessed with an Erdtree incantation.
Sunlight feels all the warmer in darkened lands.
info: Generate sunwarmth that continually heals all nearby creatures, including enemies, for 30 HP per second for 30 seconds; stacks with Frenzyflame Stones for a combined 65 HP per second while both zones overlap.

name: Charming Branch
caption:
Branch blessed with an incantation of unalloyed gold.
Those who would otherwise be at each other's throats are united in service to Miquella, as long as the charm that binds them remains intact.
info: Stab an enemy to charm the struck foe and nearby targets so they fight as allies for 30 seconds; the charm radiates outward on impact, letting a single thrust capture an entire cluster.

name: Miriam's Vanishing
caption:
Sorcery of a preceptor who served the Carian royal family.
The curator of the study hall was such a master of this sorcery that it now bears her name.
info:
Conceal yourself in a glintstone haze before reappearing a few steps away; directional inputs set the exit point.

Category: Carian Support Sorcery

name: Glintblade Trio
caption:
An old sorcery of the Carian royal family.
The prototypical form of sword-phalanx sorceries saw a different subsequent refinement in the realm of shadow.
info:
Create a sigil overhead that releases three enemy-seeking glintblades after a short delay; charging lengthens the delay and increases potency, and a charged cast can be followed immediately by an uncharged volley so both strike together.

<font color="#57DBCE">Base magic damage</font> (per glintblade): 109% of sorcery scaling uncharged / 127% when fully charged
<font color="#C0B194">Stance damage</font> (per glintblade): 4 uncharged / 6 charged
Category: Carian Glintblade Sorcery

name: Rellana's Twin Moons
caption:
Sorcery of Rellana, the Twin Moon Knight.
Associated with a Carian princess.
In her childhood, she and her elder sister Rennala met these moons. Overlapping, as though nestled against one another.
info:
Incarnate overlapping twin moons that crash into the ground in succession, unleashing moonlight shockwaves that shake the earth; requires 72 <font color="#E0B985">intelligence</font>, leaves the caster stationary while channeling, and grants immunity to grab attacks while transformed into a moon.

Category: Moon Sorcery

name: Glintstone Nail
caption:
Glintstone sorcery of Count Ymir, High Priest.
One of the finger sorceries said to have been discovered in a hallowed ruin.
Count Ymir boasts that this is mere child's play, an echo of a greater truth.
info:
Fire a heavy glintstone nail that crumbles in flight, striking foes with the projectile before bursting into shards for lingering <font color="#57DBCE">magic damage</font>; it travels slower than common glintstone projectiles but has superior tracking and range, and charging increases damage and stance pressure.

<font color="#57DBCE">Base magic damage</font> (projectile): 216% of sorcery scaling uncharged / 269% when fully charged
<font color="#C0B194">Stance damage</font> (projectile): 3 uncharged / 5 charged
Category: Finger Sorcery

name: Glintstone Nails
caption:
Glintstone sorcery of Count Ymir, High Priest.
One of the finger sorceries said to have been discovered in a hallowed ruin.

Count Ymir boasts that this is mere child's play, an echo of a greater truth.
info:
Launch six tracking magic nails that crumble on impact after a medium flight, traveling slightly slower so the projectiles can home in on distant targets.

<font color="#57DBCE">Base magic damage</font> (each nail): Sorcery Scaling x 0.66 uncharged / Sorcery Scaling x 0.75 charged
<font color="#C0B194">Stance damage</font> (each nail): 2 uncharged / 4 charged
Category: Sorcery

name: Blades of Stone
caption:
Gravity-manipulating sorcery of Commander Gaius.

Gaius and Radahn were good rivals in their youth, and this sorcery is a product of their friendly competition.
info:
Rip blade-like clumps of rock from the earth, creating eruptions beneath foes that can extend farther and split into multiple blasts when charged.

Base standard damage (uncharged): Sorcery Scaling x 2.61
Base standard damage (charged): Sorcery Scaling x 3.02
Additional eruptions (charged): Sorcery Scaling x 1.85 each
<font color="#C0B194">Stance damage</font> (per eruption): 8 (24 total when fully charged)
Category: Sorcery

name: Gravitational Missile
caption:
One of the glintstone sorceries that manipulates gravitational forces.

Said to have originated in the lightless dark far beyond-the home of the fallingstar beasts.
info:
Fire a gravitational orb that tugs enemies twice toward it before exploding; pulses have moderate stagger with a delay that weakens them versus high-<font color="#E0B985">poise</font> or evasive foes, and charging extends range and adds another pulse.

<font color="#57DBCE">Base magic damage</font> (explosion): Sorcery Scaling x 2.79 uncharged / Sorcery Scaling x 3.38 charged
<font color="#57DBCE">Base magic damage</font> (pulse): Sorcery Scaling x 0.30 uncharged / Sorcery Scaling x 0.40 charged
<font color="#C0B194">Stance damage</font>: pulses 3 each (additional 3 when charged); explosion 10
Pulse radius: 5 meters (5.5 meters when charged); explosion radius: 6 meters
Category: Sorcery

name: Mantle of Thorns
caption:
Sorcery of those who abandoned the practice of incantations after devout faith rewarded them with only despair.

The image of the misshapen Scadutree is an edict:
Spurn all that exists. Wound all that exists.
For we have been abandoned.
info:
Spend 50 HP and apply 25 <font color="#C84343">Hemorrhage</font> buildup to coat the body in Scadutree thorns that add 87 <font color="#F395C4">physical damage</font> to dodge rolls for 30 seconds and wound foes that touch them.

Category: Sorcery

name: Impenetrable Thorns
caption:
Sorcery of those who abandoned the practice of incantations after devout faith rewarded them with only despair.

The image of the twisted Scadutree is an edict:
Denounce their ways. Do them harm.
For they have abandoned us.
info:
Spend 50 HP and 25 <font color="#C84343">Hemorrhage</font> buildup to unleash three thorn trails from the earth that track enemies at medium-to-long range.

<font color="#57DBCE">Magic damage</font> (per hit): Sorcery Scaling x 0.63
<font color="#C0B194">Stance damage</font> (per hit): 1.67
<font color="#C84343">Hemorrhage</font> buildup (per hit): 17 (up to 153 per cast)
Category: Sorcery

name: Rings of Spectral Light
caption: Sorcery practiced by the keepers of the spiritgraves, where all death ultimately drifts.
info:
Conjure six lemniscate rings that fire together after a short delay, dealing ghostflame magic over very long distance while inflicting frost buildup without any stagger.

<font color="#57DBCE">Base magic damage</font> (ring): Sorcery Scaling x 0.53 uncharged / Sorcery Scaling x 0.63 charged
<font color="#C0B194">Stance damage</font> (ring): 1 uncharged / 1.5 charged
<font color="#9DD7FB">Frostbite</font> buildup: 19 per hit (up to 114)
Category: Death Sorcery

name: Vortex of Putrescence
caption:
Sorcery used by the Putrescent Knight.

In an age long past, Death was burned by ghostflame. Even the remains of tainted flesh were given equal treatment in death.
info:
Shoot a whirl of putrescent jets that combust upon impact and send ghostflame trails back toward the caster, delivering a single strike that knocks enemies down with short stagger; not boosted by the Prince of Death's Staff.

<font color="#57DBCE">Base magic damage</font> (impact): Sorcery Scaling x 3.28
<font color="#9DD7FB">Frostbite</font> buildup: 170
<font color="#C0B194">Stance damage</font>: 5
Category: Death Sorcery

name: Mass of Putrescence
caption:
Sorcery originating from the putrid liquor of the stone coffins.

In an age long past, Death was burned by ghostflame. Even the remains of tainted flesh were given equal treatment in death.
info:
Heave a putrescent mass that pierces foes before exploding in ghostflame, best aimed at a surface because the projectile passes through enemies; charging increases the AoE and the spell shares a long casting animation (about 1.8 seconds uncharged, 3 seconds charged) with Cannon of Haima.

<font color="#57DBCE">Base magic damage</font> (mass): Sorcery Scaling x 0.80 uncharged / Sorcery Scaling x 1.00 charged
<font color="#57DBCE">Base magic damage</font> (ghostflame): Sorcery Scaling x 2.00 uncharged / Sorcery Scaling x 3.00 charged
<font color="#9DD7FB">Frostbite</font> buildup: direct hits inflict 40 buildup (50 charged) and the ghostflame adds 120 buildup (150 charged)
<font color="#C0B194">Stance damage</font>: mass 5; ghostflame 7 (13 when charged)
Category: Death Sorcery

name: Furious Blade of Ansbach
caption:
Incantation of Ansbach, Pureblood Knight.

Markedly different from the finessed swordplay of the dynast, this is an aggressive last resort of an incantation that gave rise to Ansbach's fearsome reputation.
info:
Summon a bloodflame blade from the hand and lunge through foes with successive slashes, each applying a stacking Bloodflame bleed; charging attempts a fourth slash, [the extra hit rarely connects due to a known 1.13 bug].

<font color="#F48C25">Base fire damage</font>: Incant Scaling x 0.97 per slash and Incant Scaling x 1.54 for the final flame hit (charged: Incant Scaling x 0.98 per slash and Incant Scaling x 1.63 final hit)
<font color="#C84343">Hemorrhage</font> buildup from 3 hits: 180 total, 3 per tick, 10 times per second for 2 seconds, per hit
<font color="#C0B194">Stance damage</font>: 4+4+2 (10 total)
Category: Blood Oath Incantation

name: Heal from Afar
caption:
An Erdtree incantation discovered in the realm of shadow.

Even when far beyond, far out of sight, the Erdtree will surely give us its blessing.
info:
Fire a glowing projectile that heals allies on contact and can be aimed at the ground for instant effect, also damaging Wraiths and Revenants while breaking their stance without drawing aggression.

Self heal: 4.2x <font color="#E0B985">Faith</font> scaling HP
Ally heal: 3.36x <font color="#E0B985">Faith</font> scaling HP within 6 meters
Damage vs Wraiths/Revenants: (0.5% <font color="#E0B985">maximum HP</font>) + 300
Category: Ancient Erdtree Incantation

name: Aspects of the Crucible: Thorns
caption:
Aspect of the Crucible that manifested in golden hippopotami.

In an age long past, before this land was enshrouded in shadow, the vitality of the Crucible flourished. Remains of this can be seen in the ancient ruins.
info:
Create a bristling mass of thorn-like fur on the caster's back before rolling across the ground to scour the area, dealing pierce damage while charging increases potency and duration.

<font color="#C0B194">Stance damage</font>: 0.6 per hit (five hits when charged)
Category: Ancient Erdtree Incantation

name: Aspects of the Crucible: Bloom
caption:
Aspect of the Crucible discovered in the ancient ruins.

In an age long past, before this land was enshrouded in shadow, the vitality of the Crucible flourished.
info:
Plant a miranda flower on the chest before calling down a rain of golden pillars after roughly 2.2 seconds (2.55 charged); charging increases damage by 25%.

<font color="#C0B194">Stance damage</font> (per projectile): 2
Category: Ancient Erdtree Incantation

name: Minor Erdtree
caption:
Secret incantation of Queen Marika.
Only the kindness of gold, without Order.

Marika bathed the village of her home in gold, knowing full well that there was no one to heal.
info:
Summon an illusory Minor Erdtree that heals allies every 0.25 seconds for 30 seconds over a radius that grows from 0.3 to 3 meters, draws enemy attention, damages Wraiths and Revenants, and does not heal enemies standing beside the caster; stacks with other healing zones.

Healing: 9 HP per tick for 30 seconds (1080 total)
Damage vs Wraiths/Revenants: (3% <font color="#E0B985">maximum HP</font>) + 10
Category: Ancient Erdtree Incantation

name: Land of Shadow
caption:
Incantation originating from Scadutree avatars.

This incantation channels the force of the Scadutree's power, and its gold is accompanied by shadow.
info:
Call down a hail of golden projectiles after a brief delay, letting the Scadutree's shadowed power rain down across foes.

Category: Ancient Erdtree Incantation

name: Wrath from Afar
caption:
An Erdtree incantation discovered in the realm of shadow.

When the Elden Ring was shattered, the people of the realm of shadow felt it too-and feared it as a sign of the Erdtree's wrath.
info:
Release a golden shockwave that knocks foes down while dealing <font color="#F5EB89">holy damage</font>; charging increases its reach and stagger.

Radius: 2 meters uncharged / 3 meters charged
<font color="#C0B194">Stance damage</font>: 10 uncharged / 15 charged
Note: Counts as a charged spell but is not affected by Godfrey Icon
Category: Ancient Erdtree Incantation

name: Light of Miquella
caption:
The strength of Miquella upon his deific return, wielded as an incantation.

Miquella sought to accept all that was and would be, but found one that refused to be embraced.

No wonder, as one god, and one king consort, is all the world needs.
info:
Annihilate foes with a pillar of light that erupts roughly 2.5 seconds after casting, the main burst knocking down targets in a 6 meter radius while lesser pillars stagger enemies in 1 meter pockets even if the aura is interrupted.

<font color="#F5EB89">Base holy damage</font> (main pillar): Incant Scaling x 3.75
<font color="#F5EB89">Base holy damage</font> (lesser pillars): Incant Scaling x 0.70
<font color="#C0B194">Stance damage</font>: 20 (main pillar) / 2 (lesser pillars)
Category: Miquellan Incantation

name: Multilayered Ring of Light
caption:
Incantation of those who served Miquella.

This light-ring incantation was cultivated by a tradition separate from Golden Order fundamentalism.
info:
Fire a multilayered ring of golden light that glides forward, dealing pure <font color="#F5EB89">holy damage</font>; charging increases potency but each cast replaces any existing ring, a limit shared across all players.

<font color="#C0B194">Stance damage</font>: 8 (10 charged) on the initial hit; 1.5 on follow-up hits
Category: Miquellan Incantation

name: Roar of Rugalea
caption:
An incantation of what is jokingly called "the bear communion."
Channels the power of Rugalea, the great red bear.

An incantation that is more akin to the divine invocation of the hornsent than it is to the Dragon Communion. Only through desperate battle with the feral wild can one discover a god unique to oneself.
info:
Transform into a great red bear and emit a furious roar; the uncharged version delivers a single impact, while the charged roar unleashes twelve lighter thrusts plus a final heavy strike, and headshots can stagger even when cast on horseback.

Base standard damage (uncharged roar): Incant Scaling x 1.10
Base standard damage (charged roar): 12 hits at Incant Scaling x 0.45 plus 1 hit at Incant Scaling x 1.62
<font color="#C0B194">Stance damage</font>: 14 uncharged / 42 charged
Category: Spiral Tower Incantation

name: Knight's Lightning Spear
caption:
One of the incantations of the capital's ancient dragon cult.

An incantation that was taught only to the most accomplished knights, and now a lost art in the Lands Between.
info:
Hurl a lightning spear while sigils erupt to fire two more shortly after, with follow-up bolts tracing the aim set by the first spear even if casting is interrupted; the water shockwave can trigger twice for extra <font color="#FFE033">lightning damage</font> and 2 stance, and the initial spear has +40% <font color="#E0B985">attack power</font> while the trailing bolts are -20%.

<font color="#FFE033">Base lightning damage</font> (per projectile): Incant Scaling x 1.38 uncharged / Incant Scaling x 1.64 charged
<font color="#C0B194">Stance damage</font> (per projectile): 5 (9 charged)
<font color="#FFE033">Lightning damage</font> (water AoE): Incant Scaling x 0.50
Category: Dragon Cult Incantation

name: Dragonbolt of Florissax
caption:
Special incantation of the ancient dragon Florissax.

There was a time when the priestess never knew love, and thus never used this incantation herself.
info:
Call down red lightning to surround the caster and nearby allies with a 7 meter aura for 70 seconds, raising all damage negation and boosting guard damage negation after other shields; functions as an aura buff that cannot be charged or stacked with other aura-type buffs.

Damage negation buff: +10% to all damage negation for self and allies within 7 meters for 70 seconds (+5% in PvP)
Guard buff: +20% guard damage negation after the base shield reduction
Category: Dragon Cult Incantation

name: Electrocharge
caption:
One of the incantations of the capital's ancient dragon cult.

The origin of incantations that bolster the body with lightning, and now a lost art in the Lands Between.
info:
Call down lightning to charge the caster's body, the strike dealing <font color="#FFE033">lightning damage</font> before a Body Buff pulses <font color="#FFE033">lightning damage</font> every 0.2 seconds in a 2.5 meter radius for 45 seconds, bypassing guarding and doing no stance or <font color="#E0B985">poise damage</font>; charging raises the strike by 23% and the lingering pulses by 30% while charging also increases stance.

Initial strike: <font color="#FFE033">Lightning damage</font> and 7 stance (10 charged) in a 3 meter radius
Body buff: Pulses <font color="#FFE033">lightning damage</font> every 0.2 seconds in a 2.5 meter radius for 45 seconds
Category: Dragon Cult Incantation

name: Bayle's Tyranny
caption:
One of the greatest Dragon Communion incantations.
Harnesses the fearsome power of Bayle the Dread.

Even after being consumed, the throbbing heart of Bayle continues to resist its subjugation, never weakening. One day, the fire within will consume the very body and soul of its Communion devourer. One day.
info:
Channel the dread dragon to roar with a heatwave burst that deals mostly fire and partly <font color="#FFE033">lightning damage</font>, the start-up bolt delivering light stagger before the explosion knocks foes down; cannot be charged or cast on horseback.

<font color="#C0B194">Stance damage</font>: 2 start-up lightning / 25 explosion
Category: Dragon Communion Incantation

name: Bayle's Flame Lightning
caption:
One of the greatest Dragon Communion incantations.
Harnesses the fearsome power of Bayle the Dread.

Even after being consumed, the throbbing heart of Bayle continues to resist its subjugation, never weakening. One day, the fire within will consume the very body and soul of its Communion devourer. One day.
info:
Channel the dread dragon to strike with a flame-lightning talon bone, direct hits dealing mostly <font color="#F395C4">physical</font> and <font color="#FFE033">lightning damage</font> with 30 stance and a knockdown, partial hits halving the damage and stance, and lingering flames dealing minor flame <font color="#FFE033">lightning damage</font> and 2 stance while adding 16 accumulation toward multi-hit boosts; cannot be charged or cast on horseback.

<font color="#C0B194">Stance damage</font>: 30 direct hit / 15 partial hit / 2 lingering flames
Category: Dragon Communion Incantation

name: Ghostflame Breath
caption:
One of the incantations of Dragon Communion.

The land of spiritgraves is home to all manner of dead, and even the corpses of fallen dragons found their way there. Several of them were endowed with such vivacity that even in death, they could not fully die.
info:
Spew ghostflame breath from above after a two second wind-up, dealing <font color="#57DBCE">magic damage</font> while applying <font color="#9DD7FB">frostbite</font> buildup and 4 stance per hit; the breath can be extended to breathe again, swivelled mid-cast, and used while jumping but not while riding in a roughly five second cast sequence.

<font color="#9DD7FB">Frostbite</font>: Inflicts damage equal to 10% of <font color="#E0B985">maximum HP</font> plus 30, then increases all damage received by 20% for 30 seconds
<font color="#C0B194">Stance damage</font> per hit: 4
<font color="#9DD7FB">Frostbite</font> buildup per hit: 55
Category: Dragon Communion Incantation

name: Rotten Butterflies
caption:
Incantation used by Romina, Saint of the Bud.

The scarlet butterflies are as the Goddess of Rot's wings. Bereft of a master, they were soothed by Romina, who reached out to them.
info:
Summon countless butterflies that break apart on contact, scattering rot in overlapping explosions that trigger quickly and build rot on anyone standing in the cloud while briefly granting immunity to grab attacks.

<font color="#F395C4">Base physical damage</font>: 100 start-up / 100 per explosion
Base <font color="#C0B194">stance damage</font>: 5 start-up / 3 per explosion
Status buildup: <font color="#EF7676">Scarlet Rot</font> 80 per explosion
<font color="#EF7676">Scarlet Rot</font>: Inflicts 0.33% of <font color="#E0B985">maximum HP</font> + 13 per second for 90 seconds (29.7% + 1170 total).
Category: Servants of Rot Incantation

name: Pest-Thread Spears
caption:
Skill of the pests known as the Kindred of Rot, now wielded as an incantation.

The pests are abandoned servants, and it is for this reason that they found a mother in the Saint of the Bud.
info:
Secrete sticky threads and twist them into two flying spears that pierce forward; charging increases their power, they hit every piece of geometry they pass through to punish large foes, draw no enemy attention, and do not trigger multi-hit bonuses.

Base standard damage: Incant Scaling x 1.80 uncharged / Incant Scaling x 2.30 charged
Base <font color="#C0B194">stance damage</font> (per hit): 3 (4 charged)
Category: Servants of Rot Incantation

name: Midra's Flame of Frenzy
caption:
Incantation in praise of Midra, Lord of Frenzied Flame.

The Lord of Frenzied Flame shall take their torment, despair. Their affliction. Every sin, every curse. All melted away.
Yet Midra, like others before him, was too weak to become a Lord.
info:
Summon Midra's head to spew frenzied flame while the input is held, dealing <font color="#F48C25">fire damage</font> in about a 5 meter radius and stacking <font color="#EEAA2B">Madness</font> buildup on foes and on the caster until the user runs out of <font color="#E0B985">FP</font> or goes mad.

Inflicts 10 <font color="#EEAA2B">Madness</font> on enemies, and 7 on self, at 2.5/s for 1 second in a 5 meter radius. Each projectile inflicts 30 <font color="#EEAA2B">Madness</font> on hit.
Category: Frenzied Flame Incantation

name: Fleeting Microcosm
caption:
A finger sorcery of Count Ymir, High Priest.
One of the secret hallowed rites.

The broken and discarded are fully willing to cling to fleeting simulacra, earning them some modicum of sympathy.
info:
Conjure a microcosm at a foe's feet that pulses once before bursting to knock enemies down; it has moderate range and cannot bypass walls even when cast below the target.

Category: Finger Sorceries

name: Cherishing Fingers
caption:
A finger sorcery of Count Ymir, aspiring mother of fingers.

The dear fingers look after their mother, or perhaps that is merely what the mother wishes to believe.
info:
Surround the caster with a circle of hefty fingers that repel projectiles, erupting in a 2.8 meter radius (3.2 when charged) to stagger or knock foes away even if the caster is interrupted before they burst.

Base strike damage: Sorcery Scaling x 2.53 uncharged / Sorcery Scaling x 3.47 charged
Base <font color="#C0B194">stance damage</font>: 11 uncharged / 15 charged
Category: Finger Sorceries

name: Watchful Spirit
caption:
An entreaty received from the Empyrean grandam.

"Take vengeance upon Messmer and his lot.
They who betrayed us, aye, they who burned us...
Let them face in thy wrath their just deserts."
info:
Summon a guardian Skull Spirit above the caster; after roughly six seconds it begins firing four projectiles every few seconds, each dealing <font color="#F5EB89">Holy damage</font> and 5 stance, while the caster slows then stops during the cast.

<font color="#F5EB89">Base holy damage</font> (projectile): Incant Scaling x 1.0
Base <font color="#C0B194">stance damage</font> (projectile): 5
Category: Spiral Tower Incantation

name: Golden Arcs
caption:
Sorcery of the inquisitors of the tower, wielded as an incantation of the spiral.
The arcs resemble barbs, a known symbol of coercive questioning.
info:
Swing the arm to release a procession of three golden arcs that race forward; charging extends their reach and power, and they can be fired in quick succession.

<font color="#F5EB89">Base holy damage</font> (per arc): 80% of Incant Scaling uncharged / 95% when fully charged
<font color="#C0B194">Stance damage</font> (per arc): 5 (15 total)
Category: Spiral Tower Incantation

name: Giant Golden Arc
caption:
Sorcery of the inquisitors of the tower, wielded as an incantation of the spiral.

The arc resembles the barb, a known symbol of coercive questioning.
info:
Swing the arm to release a giant golden arc that tracks targets, pierces every enemy it touches, and keeps traveling through cramped corridors; charging increases its force and it can be cast in quick succession.

<font color="#F5EB89">Base holy damage</font>: Incant Scaling x 2.15 uncharged / Incant Scaling x 2.65 charged
Base <font color="#C0B194">stance damage</font>: 8 (12 charged)
Category: Spiral Tower Incantation

name: Spira
caption:
Superior sorcery of the tower priests, wielded as an incantation of the spiral.

The spiral is a normalized Crucible current that, one day, will form a column that stretches to the gods.
info:
Wrap both arms together to draw a spiral of light beneath the target, maintaining the stance as each burst erupts at the enemy's feet, retargeting between bursts despite being rooted, and holding the input to keep conjuring until <font color="#E0B985">FP</font> or <font color="#E0B985">stamina</font> runs dry; walls block the columns.

<font color="#F5EB89">Base holy damage</font> (per spiral): Incant Scaling x 1.60
Base <font color="#C0B194">stance damage</font> (per spiral): 3
Category: Spiral Tower Incantation

name: Divine Beast Tornado
caption:
The tempest of the Dancing Lion, wielded as an incantation.

The majority of divine beasts were gored and hung upon Messmer's spears, then burned in his flame. Those who witnessed the deed likened it to a funeral pyre for the tower itself.
info:
Twist the body like a whirlwind to call a storm around the caster, stunning nearby foes with the initial gust before launching a tornado forward; charging boosts damage by 25% and launches enemies upward, Torrent halts if cast on horseback, and the incantation is not boosted by the Spiraltree Seal.

<font color="#F395C4">Base physical damage</font> (tornado): 220 (275 charged)
<font color="#C0B194">Stance damage</font>: 8 tornado / 3 start-up gust
Category: Spiral Tower Incantation

name: Divine Bird Feathers
caption:
A technique of the divine bird warriors, the very first of all horned warriors, wielded as an incantation.

The divine bird warriors, and indeed this technique, are said to bear resemblance to the golden Crucible.
info:
Spread both arms like wings to scatter razor feathers while moving, allowing directional control on foot or horseback; holding the input releases continuous volleys while draining resources and the incantation is not boosted by the Spiraltree Seal.

Base <font color="#C0B194">stance damage</font> (per feather): 1
Category: Spiral Tower Incantation

name: Fire Serpent
caption:
Incantation of the Fire Knights under Messmer the Impaler's personal command.

When the flame they received from Messmer would not find purchase within them, the Fire Knights relied on fire incantations to honor their bond.
info:
Launch a serpentine flame that briefly lingers before curling toward the nearest foe, bursting instantly at point-blank range and favoring short-range duels; without a lock-on it fires at the nearest onscreen enemy or, if none, toward the ground to the left.

<font color="#F48C25">Base fire damage</font>: Incant Scaling x 1.68 uncharged / Incant Scaling x 2.10 charged
Base <font color="#C0B194">stance damage</font>: 6 (8 charged)
Category: Messmer's Flame Incantation

name: Rain of Fire
caption:
Incantation of Salza, sage of the Fire Knights.

Salza's disdain for barbarism never waned, even as he burned more villages and scorched more land than any other.
info:
Summon a cloud of flame overhead that pelts foes for roughly four seconds, landing 10-20 hits across a medium-long area; charging amplifies the storm, it shares its stance with Fire's Deadly Sin, and it manifests directly above the caster if no lock-on exists.

<font color="#F48C25">Base fire damage</font> (per projectile): Incant Scaling x 0.52 uncharged / Incant Scaling x 0.63 charged
Base <font color="#C0B194">stance damage</font> (per hit): 1.5
Category: Messmer's Flame Incantation

name: Messmer's Orb
caption:
An incantation of Messmer the Impaler.

Messmer despised his own fire. Time and time again he hoped to rid himself of it, but ever did it burn.
info:
Shape Messmer's flame into a floating orb that hurtles forward, dealing a contact hit before burrowing for a delayed explosion that knocks foes down; the cast has no hyper armor, the explosion spans 4 meters uncharged or 6 meters charged, and charging extends its travel distance and power.

<font color="#F48C25">Base fire damage</font>: Incant Scaling x 0.50 contact + Incant Scaling x 3.08 explosion (uncharged) / Incant Scaling x 0.70 contact + Incant Scaling x 4.11 explosion (charged)
Base <font color="#C0B194">stance damage</font>: 4+4 contact + 25 explosion (uncharged) / 4+4 contact + 35 explosion (charged)
Category: Messmer's Flame Incantation

name: Miquella's Great Rune
caption:
A Great Rune relinquished by Miquella.

Miquella set off for the tower enshrouded by shadow, abandoning everything—his golden flesh, his blinding strength, even his fate.

All in an effort to bury the original sin. To embrace the whole of it, and be reborn as a new god.
info: Permanently negate all charm and enthrallment effects placed upon the Tarnished while within the realm of shadow, rendering every compulsion, seduction, or obedience spell powerless without needing to equip or activate the rune.

name: Igon's Furled Finger
caption:
Furled finger of Igon, the broken drake warrior.
Gnarled and knotty, and deeply discolored on the inside.

"My soul yet lies on the mountain."
info: Summon Drake Warrior Igon from his summon sign inside Bayle the Dread's arena, calling forth his greatbow barrages to distract the dragon; Igon cannot be harmed yet still draws Bayle's aggression for the duration of the duel.

name: Hole-Laden Necklace
caption:
A pale-blue necklace made from a thin, elongated stone hollowed out from the inside.

It was a teaching of Count Ymir. The fate of the one who sounds the hanging bell will be guided by the stars.
info: Use at any hallowed ruin to ring the suspended bell, dispelling the wards placed there by Count Ymir and advancing his ritual teachings.

name: Heart of Bayle
caption:
The biatrial heart of Bayle the Dread.
Dotted with horn-like gravel stones and glistening with deep-red liquor.

The purest form of Communion, in the words of its priestess.
info: Offer at the Grand Altar of Dragon Communion to receive either Bayle's Flame Lightning or Bayle's Tyranny, consuming the heart in the process.

name: Larval Tear
caption:
An exceptionally rare creature that burgeons from spiritgraves and lives only a fleeting existence.
Neither flesh nor spirit, but something in between.

Material required by the amber egg cradled by Rennala, Queen of the Full Moon, to birth people anew.
info:
Present to Rennala, Queen of the Full Moon, to be born anew and fully redistribute every attribute gained from leveling; each rebirth consumes one tear.
Cannot be dropped for other players and carries over into New Game Plus.

name: Hefty Cracked Pot
caption:
This hefty empty pot somehow mends itself when broken.

The greater potentates of Bonny Village craft these and store them in a frozen gaol.
info: Store crafted hefty throwing pots in this vessel; when a hefty pot is thrown, the empty container automatically returns to your inventory after combat so you can craft again.

name: Revered Spirit Ash
caption:
Spirit ash of those who came before, infused with potent spirituality. Acquired from the corpses of hornsent and other objects that ritually decorate townships and villages across the realm of shadow.

The withered corpses were called tutelary deities, and Revered Spirit Ash was said to quietly accumulate in the palms of their hands.
info:
Consume at a site of grace to increase the Revered Spirit Ash Blessing level, permanently boosting summoned spirits' and Torrent's ability to deal and negate damage within the realm of shadow.
The blessing provides no benefits in the Lands Between.

name: Viridian Hidden Tear
caption: A crystal tear formed slowly over the ages, where the scattered sap of the Scadutree pools deep within the furnace golems.
info: Mix into the Flask of Wondrous Physick to eliminate all <font color="#E0B985">stamina</font> consumption for 15 seconds before the tear's power dissipates.

name: Crimsonburst Dried Tear
caption: A crystal tear formed slowly over the ages, where the scattered sap of the Scadutree pools deep within the furnace golems.
info:
Create a radiant aura for 3 minutes that steadily restores HP of nearby allies by 7 per second.
Affects allied players, friendly NPCs, and Spirit Ashes only, and the aura emits a faint guiding light.

name: Crimson-Sapping Cracked Tear
caption: A crystal tear formed slowly over the ages, where the scattered sap of the Scadutree pools deep within the furnace golems.
info:
Restore 0.75% of your <font color="#E0B985">maximum HP</font> each time an attack lands for 45 seconds.
The healing amount per hit is unaffected by damage dealt, enemy count, or attack type.

name: Cerulean-Sapping Cracked Tear
caption: A crystal tear formed slowly over the ages, where the scattered sap of the Scadutree pools deep within the furnace golems.
info:
Restore 5 <font color="#E0B985">FP</font> per hit from melee attacks for 45 seconds.
Only attacks that count as weapon strikes, such as Carian Slicer, trigger the restoration; spell projectiles do not.

name: Oil-Soaked Tear
caption: A crystal tear formed slowly over the ages, where the scattered sap of the Scadutree pools deep within the furnace golems.
info:
Cause oil to drip from your body for 30 seconds, soaking nearby enemies you brush against.
Oil-soaked targets take 20% increased <font color="#F48C25">fire damage</font> and this effect does not stack with Oil Pots or Hefty Oil Pots.

name: Bloodsucking Cracked Tear
caption: A crystal tear formed slowly over the ages, where the scattered sap of the Scadutree pools deep within the furnace golems.
info:
Increase all <font color="#E0B985">attack power</font> by 20% for 3 minutes (12.5% in PvP).
Drain 0.2% of your <font color="#E0B985">maximum HP</font> plus 20 HP every second while active.

name: Glovewort Crystal Tear
caption: A crystal tear formed slowly over the ages, where the scattered sap of the Scadutree pools deep within the furnace golems.
info: Increase Spirit Ash and other summoned ally <font color="#E0B985">attack power</font> by 7.5% for 3 minutes.

name: Deflecting Hardtear
caption: A crystal tear formed slowly over the ages, where the scattered sap of the Scadutree pools deep within the furnace golems.
info:
Enhance spontaneous guards for 5 minutes, granting 100% <font color="#F395C4">physical damage negation</font>, 75% elemental damage negation, and increased guard boost whenever you deflect at the moment of impact.
Each successful spontaneous guard adds a stack that increases guard counter damage and <font color="#C0B194">stance damage</font> by 20% for roughly 5 seconds, stacking up to 4 times (80%); heavier stance-breaking attacks grant 2 stacks at once.
Only true spontaneous guards trigger these bonuses, and they also nullify any status buildup that the deflected strike would have inflicted.

name: Knot Resin
caption:
Knot-shaped lump of resin that exuded from the roots of trees.

Found near tree roots everywhere in the realm of shadow.

Serves as a primitive catalyst, making it suitable for processing using sorceries, incantations, and the like.
info: Material used for crafting items.

name: Deep-Purple Lily
caption:
A deep-purple water lily that is on the verge of wilting.

Grows in the blue flower field at the coast.

Like a syrupy poison, its nectar lulls the imbiber into sweet, velvety sleep.
info: Material used for crafting items.

name: Roundrock
caption:
Round piece of rock shaped by the water's current.

Found on the ground at places like river banks.

It breaks easily, owing to extensive cracking.
info:
Use as crafting material, or throw to deal strike damage with very poor tracking.
Its strike property lets it stagger miners, undead, and crystalians more easily despite its sluggish flight.
